description: India's squad for the 2026 T20 World Cup and the New Zealand series is set to be announced on Saturday. The leadership duo of captain Suryakumar Yadav and vice-captain Shubman Gill is expected to retain their spots despite a challenging year. Suryakumar has managed 213 runs in 18 innings at an average of 14.20 with no fifties, while Gill has scored 291 runs in 15 innings at an average of 24.25 and remains without a fifty since his T20I return.

This nature-themed facility, featuring a 'Sky Forest' with indigenous plants, aims to enhance passenger experience and boost commerce and tourism. The terminal is designed to handle millions of passengers annually, incorporating modern digital features for efficient travel.

Noted Malayalam actor-director Sreenivasan passes away at 69 in Kochi
description: Malayalam cinema mourns the loss of veteran actor, writer, and director Sreenivasan, who passed away at 69. Celebrated for his honest narratives, sharp wit, and social commentary, he gave voice to the common man. His iconic films, blending humor with profound messages, and his natural acting style, leave an indelible mark on the industry.

description: Violence erupted in Dhaka following the fatal shooting of youth leader Sharif Osman Hadi. Hundreds of his supporters allegedly set fire to the offices of Prothom Alo and The Daily Star newspapers. The executive editor described it as a "darkest night" for the media, with journalists forced to flee.

title: T20 World Cup | India think tank’s top priority: Keeping Bumrah and Pandya fresh
description: With a 50-day countdown to the 2026 T20 World Cup, India’s think-tank has made workload management its top priority, ring-fencing Jasprit Bumrah and Hardik Pandya. Bumrah will skip the New Zealand ODIs, while Pandya’s domestic appearances will be carefully rationed, as the management prioritises peak fitness and continuity in T20Is over all other formats.

Her appearance introduced a global audience to a seasoned media professional comfortable on the biggest stages.

title: Mumbai Marina project: Centre clears Rs 887cr world-class plan — top things to know
description: Mumbai is set to get a world-class marina in its harbour, a Rs 887-crore project approved by the Union government. This initiative aims to boost maritime tourism and waterfront development, creating over 2,000 jobs. The facility will accommodate 424 yachts and includes plans for a sailing school and extensive onshore amenities, positioning Mumbai as a global maritime hub.

title: Assam tragedy: Rajdhani Express hits herd of elephants, killing 8; engine, 5 coaches derail
description: Eight elephants tragically died after being struck by the Sairang New Delhi Rajdhani Express in Assam's Hojai district early Saturday. These deals will impact Medicaid pricing and introduce "most-favoured-nation" pricing for new drugs across all markets. Companies also committed to a direct-to-consumer platform and offered discounts.

Police suspect a revenge plot orchestrated by overseas gangsters, linked to the murder of another businessman allegedly by Kumar's estranged son, Deepak. The family believes this was retaliation, despite Kumar publicly disowning his son.

The most serious case involved a five-year-old boy who was kicked while playing. Police confirm Ranjan appears mentally unstable and is undergoing treatment, having confessed to the assaults due to agitation from children playing.

Police are investigating, using technical tools to trace the suspect despite a partial license plate mismatch.

This action follows a series of US military buildups and operations in the Caribbean aimed at pressuring Maduro's government.

description: Navi Mumbai International Airport (NMIA), opening December 25, will initially have higher user development fees than Mumbai airport. Adani Group aims for a unified tariff, making prices comparable soon. NMIA will also help alleviate Mumbai's severe capacity constraints by shifting some peak-hour flights.

title: ‘Dhurandhar’ box office day 15: Ranveer Singh–Akshaye Khanna starrer continues to reign
description: Ranveer Singh's 'Dhurandhar' has achieved remarkable success, dominating the box office for 15 days. The film has already crossed Rs 730 crore globally, with an impressive Rs 483 crore net collection in India. Even with new releases, 'Dhurandhar' continues to hold its number one position.

title: Delhi Confidential: New Challenges
Sessions court cannot order jail term for ‘rest of natural life without remission’, says Supreme Court
Rural indebtedness rising due to unregulated microfinance institutions: Brinda Karat
description: Leading a demonstration in front of Regional Office of the RBI, Ms. Karat said, “public sector banks are giving loans to MFIs at low interest rate. They are jacking up the interest without any cap on interest rate. The SHGs and individual women are taking loan at very high rate of interest.”

title: Phone tapping: Supreme Court extends custody of Telangana former cop

description: The Corporation will implement the ban on new licences and renewal of existing ones for the two breeds from today; GCC Council also approves new SOPs for managing stray dogs in city

Cyclone Ditwah damage in Sri Lanka | The long path from wreckage to recovery
description: Cyclone Ditwah has claimed at least 643 lives and displaced scores of people in Sri Lanka. While it has affected several villages and towns, the highest death toll has been recorded in Kandy in the Central Province. It is part of the island’s hill country that is home to the Malaiyaha Tamils, whose centuries-old precarity makes them especially vulnerable to such shocks. Meera Srinivasan reports on the disaster

description: In a dramatic turn of events at Delhi airport, an Air India Express pilot found himself grounded after supposedly attacking a passenger amidst a scuffle over a security queue. The passenger described the ordeal, sharing how he emerged with a bloodied face before the pilot’s scheduled flight to Bengaluru.

title: Winter​‍​‌‍​‍‌​‍​‌‍​‍‌ immunity-boosting foods: What to eat to stay well when temperature drops
description: Boost your winter immunity with nutrient-rich foods that support your immune system and combat respiratory infections. Experts highlight micronutrients and live microbes found in citrus, leafy greens, fermented dairy, and zinc-rich seeds, which can reduce infection risk and duration. Incorporating these foods into your diet provides essential vitamins, minerals, and antioxidants for your body's defense.

title: Gurgaon horror: Auto driver rapes minor, kidnaps 2 girls; jumps off flyover to evade arrest
description: An auto driver kidnapped two minor sisters, sexually assaulting the elder one in Manesar. A passerby alerted police, leading to a chase. The accused jumped from a flyover, sustaining leg fractures, and was apprehended. He faces charges under the POCSO Act.

title: 'Will be hit harder if ... ': Trump's warning as US strikes ISIS targets in Syria
description: Following the deaths of two American soldiers and a US civilian interpreter in Syria, President Trump announced Operation Hawkeye Strike, a severe retaliation against ISIS targets. The US is striking ISIS strongholds in Deir ez-Zor, Raqqa, and near Palmyra, aiming at weapons depots and command centers. Trump issued a stern warning to any group threatening the USA.

title: U.S. military strikes 70 targets in Syria against Islamic State fighters after American deaths
description: The attack was conducted using F-15 Eagle jets, A-10 Thunderbolt ground attack aircraft and AH-64 Apache helicopters, the officials said. F-16 fighter jets from Jordan and HIMARS rocket artillery also were used

description: Commuters faced significant disruption as Delhi enforced a ban on non-BS 6 vehicles from other states, leading to confusion and fines at border checkpoints. Many were turned back or forced to take lengthy detours, highlighting a lack of coordination and public awareness regarding the new pollution control measures.

title: Congress, CPI(M) leaders in Bengal say ‘rising infiltrators’ narrative of BJP proved wrong after SIR draft list

Sharif Osman Hadi to be buried beside national poet Kazi Nazrul Islam; protests persist
description: Sharif Osman Hadi, a key figure in recent Bangladesh protests, will be buried next to national poet Kazi Nazrul Islam. Hadi died in Singapore after being shot in Dhaka earlier this month. His death has ignited widespread protests demanding justice, with demonstrators targeting Indian diplomatic missions and alleging suspects fled to India.

title: U.S. Justice Department releases thousands of records in Epstein case, including photos, call logs

title: ‘Behead’ slogan is a call to armed rebellion, says HC, denies bail to accused
description: The Allahabad high court declared the slogan "gustakh-e-nabi ki ek hi saza, sar tan se juda" as provocative and a challenge to India's law and sovereignty. The observation came while denying bail to an accused arrested after violence during a protest, highlighting the slogan's potential to incite rebellion and its misuse.

title: Bill Goldberg & Wanda Ferraton Net Worth 2025: WWE earnings and investments

His wife, Wanda Ferraton, an actress turned businesswoman, contributes $1 million to their combined $17 million fortune. The couple, married since 2005, now balances family life with their ongoing professional endeavors.

title: CIAL hands over ₹79.82 crore dividend to Kerala govt.

title: Nurse gang-raped after knocking on wrong hotel room; 3 arrested
description: A 30-year-old nurse was allegedly gang-raped by three men in a hotel room in Chhatrapati Sambhajinagar after she mistakenly knocked on their door. The accused, including two recovery agents and an MBA student, were arrested and remanded in police custody. The victim had gone to meet a friend for financial assistance when the incident occurred.

title: Meta AI tensions: Top-paid employee calls CEO Zuckerberg’s micromanagement ‘suffocating’
description: Meta's $14.8 billion investment in Scale AI and the integration of its CEO, Alexandr Wang, into a new "superintelligence" lab are reportedly facing internal friction. Wang allegedly finds Mark Zuckerberg's micromanagement "suffocating," while some staff question Wang's experience. This shift also clashes with Meta's open-source AI philosophy, leading to executive departures.

title: Inside Josh Allen’s luxury car collection: Bills QB’s impressive garage
description: Buffalo Bills quarterback Josh Allen's impressive car collection showcases his journey from humble beginnings to NFL stardom. His garage features a mix of rugged trucks like the Ford F-150 Raptor and luxury SUVs such as the Jeep Grand Wagoneer and Range Rover Sport, reflecting his need for utility and comfort in Buffalo's climate.
